name: knuckleheadbabylon
text: Showbiz is of low mind.

name: peterjoel
text: Showbiz and Beef came from the same Circumstances. But Showbiz didn't have a friend like Ray.

name: achilleselbow
text: I can't see how having a friend like Ray would make you smarter. Except by comparison.

name: purplehaze
text: Beef may not be super high-class, but at least he can appreciate some brie.

name: saint
text: Mmwatcha say...

name: surelysmack
text: But Ray drinks it all, he sees the big picture. Showbiz is small-time. He would probably want Al Pacino to pay him back for those peanuts.

name: soticoto
text: Showbiz is of Mariana Trench mind.

name: mugi
text: But that would make him deep.

name: ted0phile
text: That play on words just rendered me sterile.

name: spicyponyhead
text: I'm sure you'll notice a...vas deferens...in your sex life.

name: kochipoik
text: Oh shit I had to read that three times before I understood the brilliance of your pun

name: dybrar
text: Yet also hella far from bright.

name: soticoto
text: Deep and low are much akin in literal meaning, much opposed in this context though.

name: dartigen
text:
You know how people talk about laughing so hard they cry?
I did not think that was possible until today.
Chubbied for making me cry at a funny thing.

name: soticoto
text: Well, improving someone's mood can often be thought to be a plus. I suppose it is a shame that I don't really get the humour of it myself however.

name: epicurus
text: We all know people like Showbiz. Beef's expressions as Showbix talks to him in the first few panels are so true.

name: woof
text: A comment left by woof was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Private_Public, jezebel, toughasnails001)

name: professorhazard
text: If you rob a man a bank, he'll be wealthy for a day. But if you *teach* a man to rob...

name: atticusonline
text: wealthy for a day? What kind of small ass banks do you rob?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: probably piggy banks.

name: atticusonline
text: I should teach people how to rob piggy banks.

name: carlyle
text:
Wait for family to leave house. Grab hammer. Find childrens room. Take.

Congratulations. You have four dollars and seventeen cents in pennies and nickels.

name: carlyle
text: And a quarter from Nebraska.

name: atticusonline
text: Not the Mayor's quarter!

name: pie4me6
text: Perfect avatar/comment synergy.

name: all-star951
text: If you build a man a fire, you keep him warm for a day. If you set a man on fire, you keep him warm for the rest of his life.

name: epicurus
text: A comment left by epicurus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ishuta, chagment, Thorfinn, soylimpio, Tragic_Johnson)

name: all-star951
text:
"Culling is the process of removing animals from a group based on specific criteria. This is done in order to either reinforce certain desirable characteristics or to remove certain undesirable characteristics from the group. ..." (Google)

Are you sure that's the word you're looking for??

Oh, here I go, correcting terms of someone who commented two years ago...

name: aaron_haynes
text: One of my oldest friends is a Showbiz. He was always on his way to being a Showbiz growing up, and now he's graduated to "borrowing" money and possessions from me and moving to different states.

name: spinynorman
text:
I know a guy like that. He's worked several construction jobs, used to have a shultzstaffen tattoo but didn't really know what it meant, once stole a Lotus and has broken up with one girlfriend about nine times.

They are now living together. I don't know, either.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: how did he possibly steal a Lotus ??

name: splendorr
text: This is an incredible question that demands an answer.

name: droplede
text: Showbiz is funny because he's true. And he's terrifying because he's real.

name: speedwell
text: Let's face it, Showbiz is robbing the local Kum & Go, not a bank.

name: yomimono
text: Chubbied because I still laugh like a preteen every time I see a Kum & Go.

name: feetnotes
text: 2nd to last panel is a Beeflike moment for Showbiz.

name: professorhazard
text: For a short time, Showbiz remembers that he is from Circumstances.

name: aperson
text: Nah, he was just thinking. It didn't work.

name: shogun
text: "Only $10,000, cash only please, no questions asked! Recoup your training fee your FIRST TIME OUT! But you haven't heard the best part.  You give us 10% of your heists! I know that doesn't sound like the best part, but you haven't heard the best part! For every friend you refer to The Academy, we give YOU $1,000, and you get 5% of their heists! Think about it! Money in the bank(tm)! Call today! KL5-2675"

name: presterjohn
text: Extra chubby for the classic KLondike exchange.

name: molesticide
text: gimme the money, i'm from switzerland (immediately shoots teller without waiting for a reply)!

name: dallovich
text: That ain't really fair on Showbiz, he knows of Acapulco!

name: vreeeee
text: For the record, Showbiz ain't the only guy to ever spread brie on a hot dog bun.

name: brokeaccount
text: I know for certain that he is definitely not.

name: oneshotnothing
text: roast beef used a question mark. discuss.

name: yingkaixing
text: It's okay. He put a couple spaces between the last word and the punctuation. he does that sometimes.

name: hellofditties
text: Why does he call it cheese if he thought it was mayo?

name: rumblefish
text: It's possible that he thought the hotdog bun was old mayo...which only raised further questions.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs (Friday - Sunday)

Pat: On to Mollie Stone's.
Teodor: Revisit of the recurring dream
Philippe: Playin' with Franky!

name: tekende
text: Best Pat blog EVER, people.

name: skiddysmith
text: Yes, that is a very good Pat blog... but this is my personal fave

name: i_love_kate
text: Philippe's made me express my reaction to his cuteness in a decidedly effeminate way. I shall not go into detail. Just imagine me clearing my throat gruffly and looking slightly admonished.

name: trumbot
text: The dropping of Showbiz's guard in the penultimate panel is touching and hilarious.

name: l_c_b
text: Showbiz ain't no armed robber. Showbiz is the guy who can barely carry off heists on the level of "snag all the change from the Take A Penny Leave A Penny plate while the cashier's back is turned".

name: diggidy
text: It's always sad when a bank robber feels that he must shoot the teller for insinuating that he knows few countries.

name: tttt2
text:
"why don't you just make ten louder, and make ten the highest number?"


"...POW!"

name: direhaggis
text:
Showbiz reminds me of every other Rock and Roll musician I grew up around. I remember falling asleep to covers of every Def Leppard, Iron Maiden, and Guns N' Roses song known among the Mulletkin. Corona and Budweiser may as well have fueled the amperage. A dream is a loud creature.

On topic: what the fuck is with him holding his gun hand around the wrist?? Straight up insecure, that symbolism.

name: yearsinhotclaws
text: Its supposed to symbolize holding a gun with both hands.

name: linning
text: Showbiz is the kind of guy who would procure only the largest revolver he could find. After breaking his wrist twice, and nose once, he now knows the proper grip to not ruin his own shit.

name: anabanananana
text: I don't know that he's pretending to hold a revolver...I think it's a pump-action shotgun.  Notice how he shucks the used shell out with the sound ch and slides a new one in with the chk.

name: krispykorn
text: pow!

name: rumblefish
text: I'm pretty sure the only people signing up for this class would be people like Showbiz...of which there are quite a few. As long as he doesn't take any personal cheques he could do ok here.

name: treatyofparis
text: The last three panels are a great example of the set-up - suspense - punchline. Onstad knows his comedy.

name: courtland
text: I had a roommate just like Showbiz at college.  All tryin' to get work done, him all tryin' to talk about nonsense, me all wondering how he got into college to begin with.  Nobody liked him.

name: zombiezero
text:
"If you have the skitters, don't go lookin' for poontang."

I got that in a fortune cookie once. Sound advice.
